snippet: As government authorities in the industrialized world work to phase out an air-conditioner coolant, HCFC-22, a black market has sprung up for it.
abstract: Enormous black market has sprung up for HCFC-22, coolant gas used in air conditioners that was banned under the terms of an international treaty because it contributes to global warming; gas is still produced in enormous volumes and sold cheaply in China, India, Mexico and elsewhere, making it a profitable if unlikely commodity for international smugglers (Series: Chilling Effect).

byline.original: By ELISABETH ROSENTHAL and ANDREW W. LEHREN

lead_paragraph: As government authorities in the industrialized world work to phase out an air-conditioner coolant, HCFC-22, a black market has sprung up for it.

headline.print_headline: As a Coolant Is Phased Out, Smugglers Reap Big Profits
headline.seo: Smugglers Sell Coolant Tied to Global Warming
headline.main: As Coolant Is Phased Out, Smugglers Reap Large Profits
